website_summaries.verdict: It might not be the most pleasant option for you or your dog, but if immediate relief is a necessity, a pet enema is guaranteed to deliver speedy results.
pros: Formulated with dioctyl sodium sulfosuccinate in glycerine to loosen stools and promote mucus production for fast relief from constipation
Suitable for both dogs and cats
An affordable and dependable  solution for occasional cases of severe constipation
cons: Can be difficult to administer correctly without help

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE BE CAREFUL
customer_reviews.text: Please be careful, it worked but made my cat really sick to the point that he was pooping blood and mucus. After my cat evacuated, he began to drool excessively and foam came out of his mouth. I read the main ingredient in the enema is not toxic to cats but it can cause severe irritation. Bathe your pet extremely well after this and make sure he is not licking itself. This costed me a visit to the emergency room, X-rays, blood work, IV fluids and anti nauseous medication. Spent more money in the ER than what I was trying to save by going to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: My cat died after
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my kitty, she died that night. So sad
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: Potent concentrate that works!
customer_reviews.text: Product really works! I have learned that sometimes my kitty doesn't need to use the full amount - a half will do, SO as soon as I open it, I express half of the contents into a small glass jar for use later. Then with the remaining half still in syringe, I add warm water and just use it as a diluted product. It works great either way.
customer_reviews.author: Bamboo

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well on my 14-year-old Chihuahua who has bilateral hernias that cause buildups right by his tail end. I administer the product and according to the literature the mass absorbs the medicine in the enema solution and softens it so my little guy is able to pass the mass. For me this is a temporary fix until we have the surgery done on him, but it works very well. I would recommend it for any pet that is constipated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Quickly
customer_reviews.text: Used this on an older, kidney compromised, 8 lb cat. Doses were administered in quarter sizes. We used a smaller syringe than the one provided which is too large for cats and tiny dogs. You can ask the pharmacist at a drug store for a "small slip-tip syringe;" they come without needles and a shorter, narrow tip. Hold tail closed and cuddle cat for a couple minutes to allow the medication to work. She will need her litter box right away following.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver for my CKD Kitty
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 yr old cat with CKD - Chronic Kidney Disease - I have used these a dozen times in two yrs to clear occasional bowel obstipation. Has saved $thousands in veterinary ER bills and the attendant stress on my kitty. They work and he recovers within a few hrs after administration and passage of the stool. These have been a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mulrooney

customer_reviews.title: saved my cat's life
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to write about my constipated cat but he wouldn't poop. This went on for a week. The vet tried to give him an enema and the result was minimal to say the least. I spent 430 dollars on meds and X-rays for him and he was still blocked. These are great to have on hand. I swirled the tip in a vaseline jar and my husband held one end and I put it in the other end..... it went right in. Like I said, you need to have these on hand for emergency problems because if your animals are like mine, they only get sick on weekends!!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Butler

customer_reviews.title: My HCM cat suffers from constipation and this is a ...
customer_reviews.text: My HCM cat suffers from constipation and this is a miracle to have on hand. Use lube, put the uncapped end in 1/3-1/2 way, administer 1/3-1/2 of the tube (clean, sanitize, recap, and save the remainder in your fridge, but leave out until room temperature when you use in the future) and your cat should deficate within minutes. Minimum clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Saved my cats life.
customer_reviews.text: My cat hated it, however, this is a miracle solution to constipation in cats or dogs. Before this, we tried everything to relieve the constipation. Warm soap enamas, pumpkin, all oils, special food, extra water, etc. nothing worked until I was desperate and bought this. IGNORE THE “VETS ONLY” warning bc if you love your pet and they are suffering and you can’t afford to go to the vet, you need this.. now. It works in just hours. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS FIRST TIME, EVERY TIME!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff WORKS! Much more effective than the home remedies. Also, you can use a little bit at a time by squirting the needed amount into a glass and drawing it into another disposable syringe. Instead of this being a one time use, I get 4-5 uses out of it. I had a major constipation problem with one of my tiny foster kittens and this works every time!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Foglia

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: Our cat had terminal kidney issues that affected her whole system. After a couple enemas at the vet, we tried Pet-Ema. We gave her half a dose at a time, and it definitely worked, usually within the hour! She was not happy about us administering it to her (of course), but we got through it. I would definitely keep it on hand for occasional use in the future because it is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: AnotherOne

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Easy to administer and cheaper than what the Vet would charge for same item.
customer_reviews.author: terence j . schulz

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my toy poodle who has a hard time with constipation. Have tried a lot of other stuff such as pumpkin but he won’t eat it, not on his food or alone. So gave an inch and the next day he got his results without straining.
customer_reviews.author: Cd

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Elderly Cat
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product that works for my elderly cat. She suffers from chronic constipation, and medicine isn't always effective, so she needs help every couple months with stubborn blockages. We give her a half dose usually, but more sometimes as the liquid doesn't always stay in. Usually within 2-10 hours she's able to pass stool. Life-saving product. Been using it for years.
customer_reviews.author: HikingMama

customer_reviews.title: Gave half the dosage, worked 12hrs later
customer_reviews.text: I was very nervous to use this product but I had brought my cat to the vet 3 times already and it was getting to be a bit costly. I ordered this and gave Angel half of the amount and I was scared because he kept throwing up afterwards. 12 hours later he pooped out 2 big ones! I’m shocked this thing actually worked. The vet had given me medicine after medicine and they didn’t work but this did.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It works....however, I only have these done at my vet. I tried doing them myself, but wasn't able to do it because I didn't have anyone to help me hold my dog. This definitely worked on the constipation though and my vet uses the same ones.
customer_reviews.author: RoseGarden

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked great, very fast, almost too fast, pissed off cat but at least she shat.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Read all the positive reviews and decided to give this a try. My cat is 18 and is very healthy except for constipation. Just as other reviewers stated, worked quickly, so be sure your pet is in an appropriate place. I would highly recommend this product. It was definitely not enjoyable for either myself or the cat, but was much less hassle than dragging him to the vet
customer_reviews.author: MissT

customer_reviews.title: somewhat of a bad first experience
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, but for some reason my cat starts foaming and drooling right after inserting the enema. I got really scared the first time and I thought I had just poisoned my cat... somewhat of a bad first experience.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Murillo

customer_reviews.title: received the product as promised, administered it to my ...
customer_reviews.text: received the product as promised, administered it to my dog as directed waited and waited and waited, with no results at all.
customer_reviews.author: norrine jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great "over the counter" product for desperate pet owners but ...
customer_reviews.text: Did work. Cats get half dose. Unfortunately my pet passed away a day after receiving the enema not sure from her condition or the enema itself. Great "over the counter" product for desperate pet owners but comes with risks.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Same product used by our vet!
customer_reviews.text: Our Maltese has been to the emergency vet three times due blockage and unable to defecate. This last time I asked the vet for 2 enema syringes that I could administer and save my dog the pain and discomfort of waiting to go to the vet.. After having used the enemas I searched and found these are the same ones the vet uses. They have been a lifesaver for my little Maltese, and have saved me thousand of dollars in vet bills.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use on cat
customer_reviews.text: Did it’s job. Had to bathe my cat afterward, but did a great job! Cheaper than vet. YAY!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: We mix this with water 50/50 so between the high fiber and this it works great. Before we started to add Metamucil to her ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a large cat with Mega Colon. Even adding Metamucil to her wet food se can't go all the time. We mix this with water 50/50 so between the high fiber and this it works great. Before we started to add Metamucil to her food we had to use it full strength. It softens the stool and lubricates well so se can go.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergencies when you know your cats history and the vet is closed.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it’s supposed to do. Just make sure you follow your veterinarian instructions.
customer_reviews.author: DawnKay

customer_reviews.title: Great service, handy product
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these from the Vet to help clear a Beagle's "birdseed blockup." They eat the seed that the birds throw out of the feeder outside, and can get really constipated. It seemed like a good idea to keep a few on hand, since there are very few contraindications to using them. They came the next day! And they cost a fraction of what the Vet charged!
customer_reviews.author: J. GrayTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Helped her when she needed it.
customer_reviews.text: This product help us keep our kitty for several more years.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: ... cat has a megacolon condition that sometimes get him super constipated. The product tip is thick and challenging ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat has a megacolon condition that sometimes get him super constipated. The product tip is thick and challenging to use without risking such delicate tissue. Also the product is 12ml, I use max 6ml for a cat. This product seems to be suited for big dogs. I'll continue using pediatric glicerin supositories for my cat - they have a much thinner tip for easy insertion and 6ml.
customer_reviews.author: APFernandes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing how well it works
customer_reviews.text: worked perfect just like it said it would. Inly gave my cat 1/2 first and she went within minutes. Gave her the other 1/2 a couple hours later... worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: and is a good quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what my vet uses, and is a good quality product
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my cat.
customer_reviews.text: My older cat has some trouble going in his potty. This product works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ron  Crawford ( Veteran)

customer_reviews.title: Dogs need to poop too
customer_reviews.text: It helped the older female chihuahua feel better and move easier
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Sladkin

customer_reviews.title: Helped my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat was like my son. He was with me for 10 years. I loved him and I miss him. This product extended the time I had with him and also helped him be more comfortable in his final days. I am very grateful for that.
customer_reviews.author: MrPuff

customer_reviews.title: So So
customer_reviews.text: Ddn't get the full benefit as stated in the description. My dog still didn't have a complete bowel movement. Product was very easy to use and insert with lots and lots of Vaseline on the tip.
customer_reviews.author: SPOKANE, WA

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to administer as well and works quickly
customer_reviews.text: My 19 year old cat recently injured his back and often needs assistance toileting. This is twice the dose a cat would need so 2 uses for the price is helpful. It's easy to administer as well and works quickly. Thanks for improving my pet's life!
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Glad to know that there’s something to use on my puppy instead of the costly vet bill
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: Work  great
customer_reviews.text: I used half of the tube on our cat & it worked great. We put her in our garage with her food & liter box, and she did go to her liter box after 6 hours. I then took a bucket with warm water & old towel to clean her & got her back in the house, she has mega colon, and the last vet bill was $255. So it is a no brainer that i will use the tube instead of the vet. I highly recommend it for anyone, it is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I only used a small amount and it worked within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: erin Clark

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this for my cat who suffers from Megacolon and it worked well... we have only used it once on the cat, but it took care of the problem within minutes. My cat suffers from severe constipation and he is on 1ml of Cisapride and 2ml of Lactulose three times a day.... so if he hasn't had a bowel movement in more than 3 days I use the enema and it works!! I am so glad this works because the three times I've had to take my cat to the vet to get "de-bulked" it cost me $500 each time!! I am getting ready to order more of these to keep handy.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to administer, and the desired results were obtained.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Santoyo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has Mega Colon and frequent bouts of severe constipation. This is a quality product that actually performs the way it says it will. Easy to use and works very well. Just ordered more of these, too.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Goode

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My male cat..I use it onece a week Cat has Super Colon disease..This beats paying vet $600 a visit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Works great!!! Used on 18 pound dog, took approximately 2 hours after deploying. Be prepared with pet pads, it will get messy. Use vasoline on the tip, its hard plastic. Afterwards, keep pet hydrated.

customer_reviews.title: My Boxer has cancer and is sometimes very constipated. ...
customer_reviews.text: My Boxer has cancer and is sometimes very constipated. I found out that I could give him an enema and found this on Amazon. It really worked. I ordered four but only used one. He was back to his old self within two days.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaJ

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy buy.
customer_reviews.text: It was open and leaked all over the box. Not a happy buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Morey

customer_reviews.title: This Product Works
customer_reviews.text: My manx cat, who was born with spina bifida, routinely needs a lot of help. I have used this product on him several times, and it works. I have no doubt it has saved his life, and me an enormous vet bill as I have heard that enemas at veterinarians can be as high as $800.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Malachowski

customer_reviews.title: Immediate effect but be careful my cat suffered from diarrhea ...
customer_reviews.text: Immediate effect but be careful my cat suffered from diarrhea for two weeks and I only used halfway of it.
customer_reviews.author: Hadeel

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and product.
customer_reviews.text: Its a great product and the same one available as a prescription from my vet, However this is a money saver over the vet.

customer_reviews.title: Enema for Cats
customer_reviews.text: My 15 yr old cat has Mega Colon and after many vet visits and thousands of dollars, when I found the same product he used on Amazon, I asked if I could give the cat the enema at home. Pet enema works very quickly, I only give 1/2 of the enema, if I give her the full enema it gives her diarrhea. I'm saving money and she doesn't have the trauma of the Vet's visit.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beats the vet price, by a bunch! Saved my old dogs life. Bought extra, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Allen

customer_reviews.title: Pet Ema
customer_reviews.text: Best is to give petro-malt daily and fish oil caps 3times a week for my 13yr old feline, but sometimes he requires an enema, this is the brand we prefer, bless his heart.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your pet. You never know ...
customer_reviews.text: A must have for your pet. You never know when they need a little help moving their vowels when constipated.

customer_reviews.title: One Star

customer_reviews.title: ... my cat and he is back to his playful happy self. Thank you PRN Pharmacal
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on my cat and he is back to his playful happy self. Thank you PRN Pharmacal. :)
customer_reviews.author: Z.W.T.

customer_reviews.title: Home use
customer_reviews.text: We needed this for our 20 year old cat. Was easy to use and worked without the need to visit a Vet.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I think the nozzle on the syringe was a little too big for a small yorkie puppy
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Trinder

customer_reviews.title: Great for ocassional constipation -not as a permanent solution
customer_reviews.text: Great product BUT please note it should not be used permanently. If your pet requires use of this product constantly, seek veterinary assistancy since chronic constipation can lead to major problems nad emergency surgery (mega colon). Try to incorporate olive oil and pumpkin pure to the diet to help bowel movement, as well as fiber. TRy more canned pet food than dry. Prescription diet (hills's) "wd" is very helpful. PLEASE Consult w your vet.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my 65lb lab. I lubed the tip, and gave about 3/4 of the enema. she had a BM within 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product in my opinion.....
customer_reviews.text: If your doggy is bound up like my little Chihuahua was then get this, as some reviews state, the fluid may come out at first but, give it a little time.... she is doing much better, since using this product, she was crying everyday before we used this, but it works in my opinion. I would recommend this product to anyone.... With smaller dogs, remember, ya don't have to stick the whole injector up their rear ok? Small dog = small intestines.... So take note ok?????? It worked well in my opinion, I held onto the injector after I BOUGHT it... Just for future reference..... shipping was fast also..... Kerry Summers
customer_reviews.author: Kerry S. Summers

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Only need part of the dose unless your pet is completely rock-solid. This is powerful stuff. For best results, mix some into a plain water enema.
customer_reviews.author: IsometricPragmatist

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: We have a smaller cat that needs these occasionally. We are able to get two to three uses per tube.

customer_reviews.title: Approved by my vet, works well.
customer_reviews.text: I keep a supply of these on hand because I have a cat with constipation issues. It costs a lot to get the very same enema at the vets. I take my cats to the vets for their wellness checks and for any medical concerns. I was taught when to use these and how, by my vet. The nice thing is that there is only a small amount of solution in the syringes but they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: This Product Works!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was given the enema. That day, we noticed that her poop was softer and she eliminated much more. I know that she felt better. She's an old girl, so she'll need help from time-to-time. I will use this product again. I'm very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Borum, JD

customer_reviews.text: Good price. Prompt shipment. My 16 year old cat has a chronic constipation due to kidney failure. Pet-Ema Enema works great for him. I've been using this product for a few months now.

These keep our cat with mega colon from going to the vet every couple weeks and saves us money. They usually work well, but our vet says to hold the cat upside down for about 6 to 8 minutes.

customer_reviews.text: My 17yr old cat has chronic constipation and had to be at the Vets 3 times in the last two years. This time was very difficult for her where I thought she was not going to make it. I have to keep on top pf it and monitor her closely. I used this product because she was again having difficulty and it worked well. Messy clean up but worth it for her.

customer_reviews.text: This is Not appropriate for cats. It should not be used for cats at all, due to the size and applicator. Please always check with your Veterinarian first before using any product.

product_meta.title: Pet-Ema Enema for Dogs and Cats, 250 mg, 12 ml
product_meta.description:
Pet-Ema for Dogs & Cats is a disposable enema that treats constipated pets with a safe and effective syringe dispenser.
Cats and dogs that suffer from constipation can be a symptom of a larger problem- and it's important to treat the underlying cause. However, this problem can create urgency that needs individual attention. This enema works to soften your pet's stool while your pet awaits treatment for the root of the problem.

The Pet-Ema for Dogs & Cats contains dioctl sodium sulfosuccinate in glycerine to stimulate intestinal mucosa and soften hard fecal matter. This syringe contains 12 mL of the treatment and is a disposable single dose. Don't make your pet suffer when an illness leaves them constipated- order the Pet-Ema today!

Key Features:
Safe and effective treatment for constipation
Disposable for rectal use in cats and dogs
Stimulates intestinal mucosa and softens hard fecal matter
feature_bullets: Disposable Enema for Rectal Use in Dogs and Cats
Containing Dioctyl Sodium Sulfosuccinate in Glycerine
Safe and effective treatment for constipation
